sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: StarterCode is a modern, lightweight SPA framework built with HTML, TailwindCSS, and Alpine.js. It features zero build steps, running entirely in the browser with a powerful custom engine for components, layouts, routing, state management, and an advanced controller system.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Clone the repository and start a local server:

code.snippet:
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/StarterCode.git
cd StarterCode

# Option 1: Using npx serve
npx serve -l 3000 .

# Option 2: Using Python
python -m http.server 3000

# Option 3: VS Code Live Server

sections.title: Project Organization
tips: **Use Controllers** - Separate data logic from views using the controller pattern
**Follow Naming Conventions** - Use PascalCase for controllers (UserController.js), kebab-case for views (user-detail.html)
**Group Related Files** - Keep related views, components, and controllers together
**Consistent Structure** - Follow the established directory structure (app/Views/, app/Controllers/, etc.)
**Document Your Code** - Add comments explaining complex logic, especially in controllers

sections.title: Performance Optimization
tips: **Use Controllers** - They provide automatic caching and optimized data loading
**Lazy Load Controllers** - Controllers are loaded on-demand, reducing initial bundle size
**Cache API Responses** - Use CoreUI.Cache for frequently accessed data
**Skeleton Loaders** - Improve perceived performance with skeleton screens
**Optimize Images** - Use appropriate image sizes and formats
**Minimize DOM Operations** - Use Alpine's :key for efficient list rendering

sections.title: Security
tips: **XSS Prevention** - Controllers automatically sanitize data with DOMPurify
**Validate Input** - Always validate user input before processing
**HTTPS in Production** - Serve your app over HTTPS
**Keep Dependencies Updated** - Regularly update Alpine.js and other libraries
**Sanitize User Content** - Never trust user-generated content

sections.title: Code Quality
tips: **Single Responsibility** - Each controller method should do one thing well
**Reusable Components** - Create generic components that work in multiple contexts
**Error Handling** - Use onError hooks in controllers to handle failures gracefully
**Consistent Styling** - Use TailwindCSS utility classes consistently
**Test Your Routes** - Ensure all routes work correctly with different parameters

sections.title: Development Workflow
tips: **Use Development Mode** - Enable debug logging with AppConfig.mode = 'development'
**Browser DevTools** - Use console to debug Alpine state and controller data
**Live Server** - Use a live reload server for faster development
**Version Control** - Commit frequently with descriptive messages
**Production Mode** - Switch to production mode before deployment for optimized performance

problems.solution: You must serve the app through a local server (npx serve, Python http.server, or Live Server). The file:// protocol won't work.
Ensure the controller file is in app/Controllers/ and the filename matches the controller name (e.g., UserController.js for 'UserController').
The framework automatically reinitializes Alpine after navigation. If issues persist, check for JavaScript errors in console.
Check the dataSource path is correct and the JSON file exists. Use browser DevTools Network tab to see the actual request.
Ensure your route is defined with :param syntax in config/routes.js. Access params via window.Router.params or in controller methods.
Check TailwindCSS CDN is loaded in index.html. For custom styles, ensure they're in public/css/ and linked correctly.

sections.title: Debugging Tips
tips: **Enable Debug Mode** - Set AppConfig.debug = true for verbose logging
**Check Browser Console** - Most errors will be logged with helpful messages
**Use Alpine DevTools** - Install the Alpine.js DevTools browser extension
**Inspect Network Requests** - Use DevTools Network tab to see failed requests
**Check File Paths** - Ensure all paths use forward slashes and are relative to project root
**Verify JSON Syntax** - Use a JSON validator to check your data files
